frame.name: Perception
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Perceiver</fen> perceives a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. The general Perception frame is an inherited background to all frames that have to do with some sentient being responding to changes in the environment, independently of the sensory modalities. The inheriting frames may specify the modalities (<ment>see, hear, taste, smell</ment>), or may emphasize the experiences or acts of the perceiver (<ment>peek, eavesdrop</ment>), or the properties of the perceived phenomena (<ment>clank, rattle, thump</ment>).</def-root>

FE.name: Perceiver
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Perceiver</fen> refers to someone whose cognitive state or experience (e.g. knowledge, beliefs, ideas judgments or classifications) is being described.</def-root>

FE.name: Sought_phenomenon
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Perceiver</fen> is the entity or event which causes the perceptual experience of the <fen>Perceiver</fen>.
<ex>So do our domestic dogs <t>perceive</t> <fex name="Sought_phenomenon">smells</fex> with the same range of subtle `hues' as we perceive colour?</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Phenomenon
FE.definition:
<def-root> <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is experienced by the <fen>Perceiver</fen>.
<ex>Kim <t>perceived</t> <fex name="Phenomenon">a flaw</fex>.</ex></def-root>
